intro: Megacarpaea, commonly known as the golden cupplant, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange composite flowers. The plant produces large, showy capitula that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are alternate, heart-shaped, and often have a hairy texture. Megacarpaea thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks.
